triples.name: Integer programming
triples.relevance: Integer programming is the core mathematical framework underlying the SCIP optimization suite.

triples.name: Linear programming
triples.relevance: Linear programming forms the foundation for mixed-integer linear programming problems solved by SCIP.

triples.name: Mixed-integer linear programming
triples.relevance: SCIP simplifies and solves mixed-integer linear programming problems as a core functionality.

triples.name: Semidefinite programming
triples.relevance: Semidefinite programming is used in the SCIP-SDP component for mixed-integer semidefinite programming.

triples.name: Benders decomposition
triples.relevance: SCIP 7.0 provides improvements to the Benders' decomposition solver and automated decomposition support.

triples.name: Decomposition method
triples.relevance: SCIP 7.0 adds support for user-defined decomposition structures and automated decomposition algorithms.

triples.name: Heuristic (computer science)
triples.relevance: Improvements in primal heuristics are a key performance enhancement in SCIP 7.0.

triples.name: Branch and bound
triples.relevance: Branch and bound is the fundamental algorithm underlying SCIP's constraint integer programming framework.

triples.name: Symmetry group
triples.relevance: New developments in symmetry handling are part of SCIP 7.0's performance improvements.

triples.name: Conflict-driven clause learning
triples.relevance: Improvements in conflict analysis are a substantial performance enhancement in SCIP 7.0.
